main event: On March 23, 1966, a witness observed a bright object resembling a conventional aircraft without wings while driving along a highway in Temple, Oklahoma.
interesting points: The object was reported to have a plexiglas bubble on top and to be approximately 75 feet long and 12 feet wide,The witness observed a man in a baseball cap entering the object,The object emitted sounds similar to a high-speed drill and welding rod,The object rose from the ground to an altitude of 300 to 400 feet before disappearing,Various organizations were contacted but no explanations could be found for the sighting.
sighted object: a bright, wingless aircraft-like object with a plexiglas bubble
witness description: a 57-year-old civilian instructor at Sheppard AFB, Texas, with experience as a military policeman and criminal investigator
